Brock Batten is Co-Founder & Creative Director of MobileRoadie.com

As Mobile Roadie’s co-founder and creative director, Brock Batten focuses his broad skill set on leading the overall product design and development, as well as Mobile Roadie’s branding and marketing strategy. A hyper-focused creative vision has helped Mobile Roadie become the largest self-service mobile app platform in the world â€” powering thousands of apps on iPhone, Android, Blackberry, and Symbian. High profile clients include Madonna, Taylor Swift, The Beatles, Sony Music, Universal Music Group, EMI, Warner Music, Live Nation, the Miami Dolphins, Washington Redskins, NY Giants, Dallas Mavs, and the World Economic Forum.

With 10+ years of interactive design, branding, and art direction â€” including 5 years as Creative Director at Santa Monica based interactive agency Fluidesign â€” Brockâ€™s designs have been honored with numerous awards, a Webby and FWA among them. His work has also appeared in Communication Arts and Print magazines, design books by Taschen, and featured by Apple and MTV.

When he’s not consumed with advancing mobile app user-engagement, (or reading up on string theory), you might find Brock at one of his speaking engagements, which include: Harvard University, CMJ, Verizon Developer Conference, Smash Summit, Think Mobile, and Digital Music Forum.
